verses.kjv: Jotham was twenty and five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name also was Jerushah, the daughter of Zadok.
verses.ct: Jotham was 25 years old when he became king, and he ruled for 16 years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Jerushah, the daughter of Zadok.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his father Uzziah did: howbeit he entered not into the temple of the LORD. And the people did yet corruptly.
verses.ct: He did what was right in the LORD's judgment, following the example of everything his father Uzziah had done — except that he never entered the temple of the LORD. The people, however, continued their corrupt practices.

verses.kjv: He built the high gate of the house of the LORD, and on the wall of Ophel he built much.
verses.ct: He constructed the Upper Gate of the LORD's temple and did extensive building on the wall of Ophel.

verses.kjv: Moreover he built cities in the mountains of Judah, and in the forests he built castles and towers.
verses.ct: He also built towns in the hill country of Judah, and he constructed fortresses and towers in the forested areas.

verses.kjv: He fought also with the king of the Ammonites, and prevailed against them. And the children of Ammon gave him the same year an hundred talents of silver, and ten thousand measures of wheat, and ten thousand of barley. So much did the children of Ammon pay unto him, both the second year, and the third.
verses.ct: He went to war against the king of the Ammonites and defeated them. That year the Ammonites paid him 100 talents of silver, 10,000 measures of wheat, and 10,000 measures of barley. The Ammonites paid him the same amount in the 2nd and 3rd years as well.

verses.kjv: So Jotham became mighty, because he prepared his ways before the LORD his God.
verses.ct: Jotham grew powerful because he lived with consistent dedication to the LORD his God.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all his wars, and his ways, lo, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.
verses.ct: The rest of what Jotham did, including all his military campaigns and his other accomplishments — these are recorded in the Book of the Kings of Israel and Judah.

verses.kjv: He was five and twenty years old when he began to reign, and reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: He was 25 years old when he became king, and he ruled for 16 years in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And Jotham slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David: and Ahaz his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Jotham died and joined his ancestors, and they buried him in the City of David. His son Ahaz became king after him.
